docs.title: Hyperliquid Dart SDK
docs.text: A strongly-typed, comprehensive Dart SDK for the Hyperliquid API.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Complete API Coverage: Access all Info, Exchange, and WebSocket endpoints.
  • Strongly Typed: All responses and events are parsed into Dart models (e.g., L2Book, TradeEvent).
  • EIP-712 Signing: Built-in support for signing orders, transfers, and withdrawals using web3dart.
  • WebSocket Support: Real-time data streaming with typed events.
  • Helper Utilities: SymbolConverter for easy asset ID mapping.

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
import 'package:hyperliquid_dart/hyperliquid_dart.dart';

void main() async {
  final client = HyperliquidClient();
  final api = InfoApi(client);

  // Fetch L2 Book
  final book = await api.getL2Book('BTC');
  print('BTC Price: ${book.levels[0].px}');
}

docs.title: Exchange API
docs.text: The ExchangeApi handles authenticated actions like placing orders, updating leverage, and transfers. All actions require a Credentials object (e.g., EthPrivateKey).

docs.title: Place Order
docs.text:
Place a limit or market order.

final result = await exchangeApi.placeOrder(
  coin: 'BTC',
  isBuy: true,
  sz: 0.01,
  limitPx: 30000.0,
  orderType: {'limit': {'tif': 'Gtc'}},
  reduceOnly: false,
);

docs.title: Cancel Order
docs.text:
Cancel an open order by its ID.

final result = await exchangeApi.cancelOrder(
  coin: 'BTC',
  orderId: 123456789,
);

docs.title: Update Leverage
docs.text:
Set the leverage mode (Cross/Isolated) and value for an asset.

// Set 10x Cross Leverage
await exchangeApi.updateLeverage('BTC', true, 10.0);

// Set 5x Isolated Leverage
await exchangeApi.updateLeverage('ETH', false, 5.0);

docs.title: USD Send
docs.text:
Send USDC to another Hyperliquid account (L2 transfer).

await exchangeApi.usdSend('0xRecipientAddress...', 100.0);

docs.title: Withdraw
docs.text:
Withdraw USDC to the Arbitrum L1 chain.

await exchangeApi.withdraw3('0xL1Address...', 500.0);

docs.title: Spot Send
docs.text:
Send a Spot asset (e.g., PURR) to another account.

await exchangeApi.spotSend('0xRecipient...', 'PURR:0xTokenAddress...', 10.0);

docs.title: Create Sub-Account
docs.text:
Create a new sub-account managed by your main wallet.

await exchangeApi.createSubAccount('TradingBot1');

docs.title: Sub-Account Transfer
docs.text:
Transfer funds between main account and sub-account.

// Deposit 1000 USD to sub-account
await exchangeApi.subAccountTransfer('0xSubAccount...', true, 1000.0);

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Add hyperliquid_dart to your pubspec.yaml:

dependencies:
  hyperliquid_dart: ^0.1.0

Or run:

dart pub add hyperliquid_dart

docs.title: Initialization
docs.text:
The SDK is split into three main components: InfoApi, ExchangeApi, and HyperliquidSocket.

import 'package:hyperliquid_dart/hyperliquid_dart.dart';
import 'package:web3dart/web3dart.dart';

// 1. Create a client (handles HTTP requests)
final client = HyperliquidClient(isMainnet: true); // Defaults to true

// 2. Initialize APIs
final infoApi = InfoApi(client);
final socket = HyperliquidSocket(); // Defaults to Mainnet URL

// 3. For Exchange API, you need a wallet
final privateKey = 'YOUR_PRIVATE_KEY_HEX';
final wallet = EthPrivateKey.fromHex(privateKey);
final exchangeApi = ExchangeApi(client, wallet, isMainnet: true);

docs.title: Environment
docs.text:
You can switch between Mainnet and Testnet:

// Mainnet (Default)
final client = HyperliquidClient(baseUrl: 'https://api.hyperliquid.xyz');

// Testnet
final client = HyperliquidClient(baseUrl: 'https://api.hyperliquid-testnet.xyz');

docs.title: Info API
docs.text: The InfoApi allows you to retrieve public market data and account information without signing.

docs.title: Get L2 Book
docs.text:
Retrieve the Level 2 Order Book (bids and asks).

final book = await infoApi.getL2Book('BTC');
print('Best Bid: ${book.levels[0].px}');

docs.title: Get All Mids
docs.text:
Get the mid-prices for all active assets.

final mids = await infoApi.getAllMids();
print('ETH Price: ${mids['ETH']}');

docs.title: Get Meta
docs.text:
Fetch metadata about the exchange universe (asset IDs, decimals).

final meta = await infoApi.getMeta();
for (var asset in meta.universe) {
  print('${asset.name}: ID ${asset.szDecimals}');
}

docs.title: Get User State
docs.text:
Retrieve detailed account information (balances, positions, leverage).

final state = await infoApi.getUserState('0x...');
print('Account Value: ${state.marginSummary.accountValue}');
for (var position in state.assetPositions) {
  print('Position: ${position.position.coin} ${position.position.szi}');
}

docs.title: Get Open Orders
docs.text:
Fetch all open orders for a user.

final orders = await infoApi.getOpenOrders('0x...');
for (var order in orders) {
  print('Order: ${order.coin} ${order.limitPx}');
}

docs.title: Symbol Converter
docs.text: The HyperliquidSymbolConverter helps map human-readable symbols (like "BTC") to the internal Asset IDs required by some API responses or logic.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
final converter = HyperliquidSymbolConverter(infoApi);

// Load metadata first
await converter.reload();

// Get Asset ID
final btcId = converter.getAssetId('BTC'); // Returns int (e.g., 4)

// Get Size Decimals
final decimals = converter.getSzDecimals('ETH'); // Returns int (e.g., 3)

docs.title: Signing Utils
docs.text:
The SigningUtils class handles the complex EIP-712 signing logic required for the Exchange API.

Note: You typically don't need to use this directly if you use ExchangeApi, but it's available for custom implementations.

import 'package:hyperliquid_dart/src/utils/signing.dart';

// Sign a custom action
final signature = await SigningUtils.signUserSignedAction(
  wallet,
  actionMap,
  typeDefinitions,
  'PrimaryType',
  42161, // Chain ID
);

docs.title: WebSocket API
docs.text: The HyperliquidSocket provides real-time access to market data and user events.

docs.title: Connection
docs.text:
final socket = HyperliquidSocket();
await socket.connect();

docs.title: L2 Book
docs.text:
Subscribe to real-time order book updates.

socket.subscribeToL2Book('BTC');

docs.title: Trades
docs.text:
Subscribe to real-time trades.

socket.subscribeToTrades('ETH');

docs.title: User Events
docs.text:
Subscribe to your own fills and account updates.

socket.subscribeToUserEvents('0xYourAddress...');

docs.title: Handling Events
docs.text:
The SDK provides a typed stream of events. You can listen to socket.stream and check the type of the event.

socket.stream.listen((message) {
  if (message is L2BookEvent) {
    print('Book Update: ${message.data.coin}');
  } else if (message is TradeEvent) {
    print('New Trades: ${message.data.length}');
  } else if (message is UserEvent) {
    print('User Update: ${message.data}');
  }
});

docs.title: Closing
docs.text: await socket.close();
